name: Android Pony Express Package File
summary: An APEX file is a Zip-compressed package that Google and other Android device manufacturers use for distributing updates to low-level system libraries on Android devices. APEX files contain an apex_manifest.json, AndroidManifest.xml, apex_payload.img, and apex_pubkey file used to update one or more components in Android. The files in an APEX archive are packaged using Googleâ€™s Android Pony EXpress (APEX) specification, which Google introduced with Android Q (Android 10) in September 2019.
